undrawnCards.title: Custer's Other Stands
undrawnCards.desc:
General George Armstrong Custer clinches another victory at the battle of
      Little Sands. His trusty steed Cairo is not so lucky.

undrawnCards.title: Picante Sauce Commercial
undrawnCards.desc:
A dozen grizzled cowboys surround a fire. Suddenly, they exclaim, "That's
      not mayonnaise!"

undrawnCards.title: Thirteen the Hard Way
undrawnCards.desc:
After operating for only six minutes, the Pony Express disbands and gives
      way to the international Telegraph and Railroad systems. Little boys cry.

undrawnCards.title: Taffy Commercial
undrawnCards.desc:
Jackson encourages the children to eat only taffy, because gum can kill
      them stone dead.

undrawnCards.title: The Way the West Was Run
undrawnCards.desc:
Jose explains patiently, but with thinly veiled contempt, the intricacies
      of Arizona bureaucracy, as though speaking to a simple and distracted child.

undrawnCards.title: How They Get Milk
undrawnCards.desc:
Josie is thoroughly off milk at this point. The Milkman shows her one more
      way that she might not have heard of before.

undrawnCards.title: Gum Commercial
undrawnCards.desc:
Inspector Pete speaks to a riveted audience about the many hidden dangers
      of taffy, not the least of which is that taffy can kill you stone dead.

undrawnCards.title: My Years on the Prairie
undrawnCards.desc:
Louise takes instruction from Henry, the neighbor boy, in an absurdly
      suggestive explanation of how to plow a field.

undrawnCards.title: Thirteen the Hard Way
undrawnCards.desc:
After some delay, the Pony Express arrives. Isaac, Gwen, Francis, Terry,
      Conrad, Brooke, Jerry, Howard, MacNeill, Jones, Spike, Cornwall and
      Crawford are all there.

undrawnCards.title: Law and the Old West
undrawnCards.desc:
Charlie "Three Guns" Henderson cooperates with Johnny Law and reluctantly
      enters the witless protection program.

undrawnCards.title: Square Deal City
undrawnCards.desc:
Douglas and Katherine confront Aunt Martha about her missing pies.  Devin
      sulks quietly in a side room.

undrawnCards.title: Swing 'em Wide
undrawnCards.desc: Hector makes a surprising discovery behind the Chinese grocery store.

undrawnCards.title: Beyond the Pail: Life without Lactose
undrawnCards.desc:
Henry discovers for the first time that his ability to digest cream has
      disappeared along with his hair.  Other cowboys attempt to console him.

undrawnCards.title: Jesse James: Man of Action
undrawnCards.desc:
A hail of gunfire results when Jesse's friend Barton marries Jesse's
      childhood sweetheart.

undrawnCards.title: J. Robert Lucky, Man of Substance
undrawnCards.desc:
Horace and Mathilde discover that the mysterious orange powder filling
      Doctor Lucky's air vents is neither Agent Orange nor weaponized Tang, but
      a rare form of cheese mold.

undrawnCards.title: A Man Called 'Cow'
undrawnCards.desc:
Nothing will settle the debates among the skeptical locals, short of a
      demonstration of Hector's special talents.

undrawnCards.title: Trials of the First Pioneers
undrawnCards.desc:
A fire breaks out in the town livery. Before long, the surrounding
      buildings are engulfed in flame. The world falls into chaos.

undrawnCards.title: Ol' Shooter and Little Doll
undrawnCards.desc:
Shooter discovers that he has been proceeding for days with no trousers.
      This causes him no small embarrassment as he searches for them with Little
      Doll.

undrawnCards.title: Go West, You!
undrawnCards.desc:
Susan and Peter encounter some of the perils of the Badlands: rutted mud
      roads, torrential rain storms, and a bad case of "grumbly tummy."

undrawnCards.title: The Robbers of Trains
undrawnCards.desc:
Coogan confronts the toughest thug in his gang, Big Jake, in an
      abbreviated knife fight.  Coogan settles the dispute with fearless guile
      and a kick in the family jewels.

undrawnCards.title: Czechs in the Sonora
undrawnCards.desc:
Bob reverts to his ancestral ways in a short fight
      over a disembodied hand.

undrawnCards.title: The Search for Maggie White
undrawnCards.desc:
Alone in the wilderness, Maggie makes the best of her situation. In what
      seems like no time at all, she constructs a sturdy two-story house from
      branches and mud.

undrawnCards.title: One False Step for Mankind
undrawnCards.desc:
After a dozen failed attempts, one rocket carries Horatio and his six
      children to the Moon, where they enjoy a picnic and a spirited game of
      badminton.

undrawnCards.title: Disaster at Flying J
undrawnCards.desc:
After the mine explosion, the traveling circus takes time out to get drunk
      and start a fight.

undrawnCards.title: Down in the Valley
undrawnCards.desc:
A tripped waiter is the spark igniting a brawl of cataclysmic
      proportions.  Walter is injured in the neck.

undrawnCards.title: Evil Wears a Hat
undrawnCards.desc: Calhoun is separated from the group during a white-knuckled chase near Desperation Bluff.

undrawnCards.title: Swing 'em Wide
undrawnCards.desc:
Black Jack invites Dixon and The Captain to a late-night poker
      game. Little do they know that Gertrude and Isabella await them at the
      table.

undrawnCards.title: The Life and Times of John Skywater
undrawnCards.desc:
John discovers his long-lost sister Marcie, and instructs her in the ways
      of gunfighting and whiskey distillation.

undrawnCards.title: Buffalo Bill: The Lost Years
undrawnCards.desc:
Buffalo Bill's companion Marty disappears in a freak electrical storm.
      Bill enlists the aid of the Sidekick Friends network.

undrawnCards.title: Breakin' in Trick Ponies
undrawnCards.desc: Uncle Stewart reveals what to do when all else fails.

drawnCards.title: How the Grinch Stole Texas
drawnCards.desc:
The doe-eyed citizens of El Paso gather together around a warm fire and
      pray for the safety of those poor souls in Oklahoma. It almost works.

drawnCards.title: Shakespear in Lubbock
drawnCards.desc:
William decides that it is time to be movin' on.  Julia convinces him to
      stick around just long enough to get into big trouble.

drawnCards.title: Jesse James: Man of Action
drawnCards.desc:
Jesse's brothers Jed and Henry throw him a surprise birthday party.
      Jesse's nerves get the better of him when the birthday cake explodes.

drawnCards.title: How They Get Milk
drawnCards.desc:
Josie asks the Milkman how they get milk. After a thoughtful pause, he
      begins. "Not like you'd expect!"

drawnCards.title: The Life and Times of John Skywater
drawnCards.desc:
Disheartened by his lack of business acumen and his poor choice of
      investment partners, John Skywater sets off into the Cree Nation to
      convince them to kidnap his wife.

drawnCards.title: My Years on the Prairie
drawnCards.desc:
Virgil and Stacy set out at midnight to track down the stray cows, unaware
      that they are being pursued by inch-high aliens from outer space.

drawnCards.title: Davy Crockett: A Drunkard's Tale
drawnCards.desc:
In an absurd dream sequence, Crockett recalls an episode of fear and chaos
      in which his childhood friend Timmy was trapped at the bottom of a well.

drawnCards.title: Gun! The Musical
drawnCards.desc: A song and dance extravaganza, "Hunka Hunka Burnin' Lead."

drawnCards.title: Humor at the Expense of Others
drawnCards.desc:
Phil and his cohort of unfeeling smart-mouths make fun of Sancho and his
      great big hat.

drawnCards.title: Davy Crockett: A Drunkard's Tale
drawnCards.desc:
Robert enlists the aid of several farm animals in order to ascertain the
      efficacy of his new hangover remedy.

locationRoles.name: Man in Overalls
locationRoles.line: Looks like a storm's comin' in.

locationRoles.name: Flustered Teller
locationRoles.line: Would you like a large bill, sir?

locationRoles.name: Dangerous Tom
locationRoles.line: There's two ways we can do this....

locationRoles.name: Penny, who is lost
locationRoles.line: Oh, wow! for I am lost!

locationRoles.name: Reluctant Farmer
locationRoles.line: I ain't so sure about that!

locationRoles.name: Cyrus the Gunfighter
locationRoles.line: Git to fightin' or git away!
